messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Looking for hsing family in Kauai
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/25/01 12:28:02 PM Pacific Standard Time, lptn@astound.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/25/01 12:28:02 PM Pacific Standard Time,
lptn@... writes:

<< Mango Mama lives on Maui.
>>

Actually I found them their ad in the back of Mothering Magazine. Check out
this link <A HREF="http://www.skyfamily.com/northcountryfarms/">North Country
Farms</A> www.skyfamily.com/northcountryfarms <--no
.com at the end, they are a hsing family on the island of Kauai who live and
farm organic produce which they sell exclusively to 50 families a week in
addition they have a bed and breakfast cottage that they rent out.
Unfortunately
they are booked the week we are going to be there but I hope to stop by.
Their home and land look beautiful!
Kathy

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Looking for hsing family in Kauai
messages.msgSnippet: I lost the original request on this, but here is something the family in Hawaii might be interested in. Lynda Homeschool.com January 2001 Homeschool.com is
messages.messageBody:
I lost the original request on this, but here is something the family in
Hawaii might be interested in.

Lynda

Homeschool.com
January 2001

Homeschool.com is Live in Hawaii
Send us your JASON Project questions!

--------------------------------------------------------------
Homeschool.com is going on location to Hawaii

Join Homeschool.com beginning Tuesday, January 30, 2001 as we explore
the Hawaiian Islands. We will go behind the scenes with the world
renowned Jason Project, meet Dr. Ballard (the man who found the
Titanic), and discover what the history books may have missed in Pearl
Harbor!

Our media team, which includes 3 homeschool children, will interview
scientists and Student Argonauts at the Volcanoes National Park in Hilo,
Hawaii. Send us your questions today! We may choose yours when we meet
Dr.Ballard!

Send your questions to: hawaii@...

To learn more about "The Jason Project" and the volcanoes in Hawaii
click here: http://www.jasonproject.org/

--------------------------------------------------------------

EDVENTURES.COM IS PROUD TO SPONSOR "ON LOCATION IN HAWAII"
http://www.edventures.com?code=oe

Edventures.com is committed to encouraging the love of science and
exploration in all kids! Edventures.com uses technology in powerful ways
to engage, motivate, and excite students about the learning process!


Click here to take a FREE course on Aqua Engineering and Oceanography:
http://www.edventures.com/courses/hawaii?code=oe

--------------------------------------------------------------

DON'T LEAVE YOUR FRIENDS OUT

Be sure to pass this e-mail on to your friends so that they too can join
us on this incredible learning experience!

Subscribe at: http://www.homeschool.com/subscribe/

Don't forget! Log-on to Homeschool.com, Tuesday, January 30, but watch
out for the hot lava!

--------------------------------------------------------
